title: Why don't grades affect your LP Gain/Loss?
body:
I don't understand why the ranked system is so primitive, when the rest of the game seems to be constantly updated. The ranking system (S,A,B,C,D) should determine the amount of LP you gain for a win, and lose for a loss. 

For example: Say you are playing a Ranked Solo/Duo game and have a team mate that plays extremely bad, to the point of receiving a D Level grade. Note that to achieve this, the player would either need to be lagging to the point that they should not be playing, or intentionally feeding. On the other hand, say you have another team mate who plays extremely well, and should obviously play at a higher level and gets an S Level grade. Now assuming that they have average MMR's for their ELO (Which is safe to say this is what the majority of players have), a loss would result in both players losing the same amount of LP, and if they win both will recieve the same amount of LP.

How does this inevitable pay off seem fair? Is Riot not trying to reward players who are serious and would like to be better at the game? Or do they just not care enough to update the system in place, which seems old-school and out of place, considering how the game has evolved so drastically since its release.

I believe that Riot may be working towards this in the future, otherwise I can't see why they would implement the grading system, but I can't understand why it is yet to be put into place in ranked games. So please Riot, think about using a system for ranked games as follows:


TEAM WINS:

(S-,S,S+) Player - Gain Approx 30 LP
(A-,A,A+) Player - Gain Approx 25 LP
(B-.B,B+) Player - Gain Approx 20 LP
(C-,C,C+) Player - Gain Approx 15 LP
(D-,D,D+) Player - Gains 0 LP


TEAM LOSES:

(S-,S,S+) Player - Lose 0 LP
(A-,A,A+) Player - Lose Approx 10 LP
(B-.B,B+) Player - Lose Approx 15 LP
(C-,C,C+) Player - Lose Approx 20 LP
(D-,D,D+) Player - Lose Approx 50 LP


While the values of the above system are just ball-park numbers I have come up with, the premise is clear. I think the most important part of this system, is that players who are losing with an S Grade, are not punished, or atleast a losing minimal LP. Whereas ranked players who receive a grade of D, should be severely penalised, to the point of recieving 0 LP for a win, and losing up to 50 or so LP for losing the game.

These ranked game changes could be an extremely effective way to allow players to stop ignorant and unsportsmanlike behaviour, such as greifing, intentionally feeding and flaming team mates. Whereas, the players who are receiving consistently high grades and are obviously trying their hardest to win are recognised and rewarded.

I'm very eager to see how Riot responds to this form of grading system in the ranked scene, if they do end up seeing this post. :)

i've been posting this here for years that personal performance should at least have some bearing on lp gain/loss. all i've gotten is riot employees and some of their yes men volunteers defending the current system of W/L or totally ignored.

I would loathe a grading system. Recently I went 0-9-2 on Azir with average cs and that legit was an A+. Also riot's grading system is terrible and exploitable, and I'd find this very frustrating.

Also when someone tries to make plays, but their team isn't always competent to follow up, you'll generally die more and have a worse kda than someone who just stands back and does the bare minimum to get the assist.

A good example is the difference between a high elo passiv-ish support like janna and a low elo one if you stuck both in bronze/silver. 
The high elo challenger one will roam, position aggressively, look for plays and good fights, they might flash in at time and ult to throw the squishy carries into their team even though this would likely kill them. They will hard carry like a god, even though they might die a few times from lack of follow up. 
The low elo Janna will stand at the back putting the shield down, probably missing their q and getting carried. 

Realistically the challenger one would be on an entire different level, but grade wise, they'd have very similar grading, the challenger one might even have a worse grade because the trash janna would probably have almost no deaths because they aren't taking risks.

Yes cc score has been implemented and as a support this is a good determinant of impact (not always, since peeling the correct targets matter), but this isn't used to determine grade.

If riot ever changes it from an mmr system to a grading system for lp, to cater for all the bronze kda warriors, then I'm quitting league. The current system is bad and only shows accuracy over a huge number of games, but a grading system for ranked gains in a moba is cancer.

again, as i always have to point out (not sure why this concept seems so hard to comprehend), its not about changing it entirely about personal performance. it's that it should have SOME bearing. it still would be about W/L for the most part, but why should someone that does extremely well but still losses receive the same "punishment" as someone who did extremely poorly? why should someone that did extremely poorly get the same "reward" if their team carries them to victory? 

we're talking about queues where you are matched with random people. this isnt a competition where you enter as a team.

it's about the system recognizing people that consistently do really well or people who consistently do really bad.

also why assume it would just be the current grade system as is. obviously they would need to tweak it or use a totally different grading system. obviously it would be a system that would be looking at just that specific game and the people in the game, not a system comparing you to the entire server. 

other games do it really well, not sure why league can't.

mobas don't have a grading system because it can be really hard to measure impact. If there was a definitive way to measure this, I'd be all for it, I've lost games as support where legitimately the only kills our team got that game were janna solo kills (if you're 10-1 ezreal and you get 1v1'd from full hp in the jungle by a support janna, then both teams are seriously retarded and they should reevaluate how they spend their lives).

But I don't think riot is ready for this type of grading system at all because as stated 0-9-2 azir, almost got a mastery token, and the current grading system measures primarily, Kills>Deaths>Cs>Factors for Gamelength>Assists (unless you are sup in which case this comes before Cs).

Grades don't measure warding, peeling or picking (mostly cc score though this isn't always accurate but this doesn't affect grades atm), no measure for flashing in the way of that caitlynn ulty or jumping into a teamfight on low hp to get a critical pick or save a carry, no measure for when your teammates bard ult you or wall you off to troll you and get you killed or when an adc refuses to burst heal to save an ally because they feel they might need it later, the grading system doesn't even really count damage dealt or absorbed. Riot measures these things, but it's hard to tell how well they've been done and so the Riot Grading system only counts Kills, deaths, cs and assists and considers gamelength to scale specific evaluation.

I've seen games lost because somebody siphoned all the kills and didn't do anything with the gold (sometimes that was me, I'll admit deathcap garen doesnt really scale well, I didn't do this in ranked but someone theoretically could). I've also lost ranked games that I was carrying hard, because I decided to try to yolo 1v5 as the support simply because I was the most fed and gotten utterly wrecked and single-handedly lost the game. My Kda and performance that game was excellent, but I was still the principle reason for the loss.
Damn this is a great idea! O:

This would disturb the balance of ranked games, people would focus more on keeping a positive score over actually winning. Some champions kits are designed so that scoring an S+ is difficult however could carry every game. (Tryndamere/Yasuo for example)

You can literally go 0/20/0 on Tryndamere and carry, assuming the enemy doesn't shut down the split push. How the game and ranked system is now is perfectly fine, If you play well, or above average in your tier list you WILL climb. You will never become stuck in an elo you don't belong at due to people on your team doing poorly. 

I suggest you focus on the game mechanics more-so and not the ranked mechanics, if you want to climb improve your gameplay, not your grade rating. 

I'm sure you've ran in to many people who feel "non-impacting" to your game, playing "too safe" these people would climb easier when really they're not doing anything but keeping a good grade rating.
I get D Grades in games where im actually trying, and B and As when trolling / trying builds/playstyles that are considered troll

Yeah, you are the reason why we want the system, so many times in my high silver/low gold games, people try and get D grades, you obviously can't play to the standard of the others in your rank. If you get a D in a bronze 1 game, maybe you should be bronze 2.
And when others play significantly well in their rank, they deserve to be higher, it really is common sense, reward the good players, 'punish' the trolls and demote the others that can't play in that rank.
Normals, do what ever you want, but ranked if there to improve and get a higher rank by playing the best you can.

Grades mean nothing. They don't count map pressure, rotations, shotcalling, vision control, solid engages, good peel and picks, damage dealt , damage mitigated, damage to objectives, amount shielded/healed, positioning, minion manipulation, objectives taken, ect...

Grades count only 5 things (or at least I can guarantee that if these are high, the others don't matter). 
In order of importance, Kills/Deaths/Cs/Game length/Assists.
If you think grades mean everything, then you belong in a depth of bronze so low, that bronze 5 looks like the surface. (Pretty sure most bronze 5 players at least get that the other factors matter)

On a side note, I've gotten S's with stupid stuff like magic pen mundo support, I went 0-6-11, I got carried, but mundo isn't a support, and he shouldn't be, and so i got an S grade for my terrible performance.

Protip: if you really want to get that S grade so that you can level up your champion mastery, do stupid stuff like jungle janna, adcrit malphite, magic pen mundo support, toplane blitzcrank, ap alistair mid. You'll feed no doubt, but if you pad your kda and steal cs, it's an easy S.

noo 1stly the grading system is a very arbitrary numerical value with no real correlation of impact in game

You definitely have the right idea, just not the right way to do it. Remember someone can go 0/5/10 but still carry the game! Also 50LP is insane to lose, you could be demoted from just 2 bad games with that.

Of course you could get demoted from two-three terrible losses, if someone plays horrible consistently, shouldn't they be punished for it?
How many games have you had where someone gets in a bad mood and feeds, and their excuse is always " its only 20LP it doesn't matter", with a loss of 50LP the frequency of these games would drop so fast, and these people who can't play the game properly and seriously, then they deserve to be demoted to the depths of bronze where they can play with people who also fed their way there.
Yes but there's also a difference between "having a bad game" and "feeding on purpose". People who feed on purpose deserve the punishment but it's not fair on people who are trying.

Don't forget that getting a grade of D or so is extremely difficult. There are basically only three ways to achieve it:

- Intentionally Feed
- Disconnect / Lag Uncontrollably
- Get super tilted and "accidentally" feed 

But the important part of this suggestion isn't the numbers, its the overall idea. Thanks for the feedback :)
Ive gotten D grades when trying to play seriously with no lag or other problems... not inting either....

You don't deserve your rank then, if its normal's, go to town, waste everyone's time, at least it doesn't have a lasting effect.
If you get a D grade in ranked, you deserve to be punished for playing badly.
You can die in lane, get the enemy strong, and still play better later and achieve a B or higher, happens all the time. Its if you consistently play poorly, that you receive a poor grade.

Yesterday I got an A+ being 0/5 as Tryndamere jungle.
It doesn't just look at the score.

This System would be great, I have been playing league for more than five years and the ranked system has not changed, when you look at newer competitive games like Overwatch, where the ranking is purely based on skill, if someone plays very poorly then they lose more points than someone who plays very very well. I am only silver one so take it with a grain of salt, a big portion of my games I play well, I try my best not to feed, I very often win lane, and seem to just outperform my opponent. I win lane, but there is not much one person can do when one person just refuses to communicate. I can get that sought after S ranking, but because of my current MMR I can lose up to 28 LP a game, when winning one I earn no more than 19. I love this game, but it really makes it hard when my performance is not rewarded when instead it is completely ignored. I completely agree with the LP gain or loss based on in game performance, if I play poorly I will accept the hit of up to 50LP. I really hope Riot sees this and implements something similar. I think it would be a breath of fresh air for lower elos. I seriously doubt it will effect high elo such as master/challenger, and if it does, it will really put the great players above the good players.
Obviously because this is a team game and kills don't mean wins. The goal of league of legends is to win the match, my god imagine how bad league would suck if they listened to you kids.
